itemDescription: British author of young adult fiction

wikipedia_page.main: Alice May Oseman (born 16 October 1994) is an English author of young adult fiction. She secured her first publishing deal at 17, and had her first novel, Solitaire, published in 2014. She is also the author of Radio Silence, I Was Born For This, Loveless, and the web comic Heartstopper. She novels focus on contemporary teenage life in the UK and have received several awards – Inky Awards and United By Pop Awards.

response: *October 16 - Alice Oseman, English author of young adult fiction

response: *Alice Oseman(born 1994) wrote the novel Solitaire  when she was 17 and it was published in 2014.
In April 2021, it was announced Croft would play Benjamin "Ben" Hope in the upcoming Netflix series Heartstopper, an adaptation of the webcomic and graphic novel of the same name by Alice Oseman.

In 2019, Connor portrayed a teenaged Sir Elton John in the musical film Rocketman and played Joe Woodard in Little Joe. That same year, he began voicing Pantalaimon in the BBC One and HBO fantasy series His Dark Materials. In April 2021, it was announced Connor would star opposite Joe Locke in the upcoming Netflix series Heartstopper, an adaptation of the webcomic and graphic novel of the same name by Alice Oseman.
* In August 2020, Costello and Kaszyca were featured on the book podcast Something Old, Something Debut to discuss Alice Oseman's novel Loveless.

In 2017, Book Riot, highlighted a small number of books with asexual characters. Book Riot pointed to characters in Laini Taylor's Days of Blood & Starlight, J.L. Douglas's Lunaside, R.J. Anderson's Quicksilver, and Seanan McGuire Every Heart a Doorway. Tor.com pointed to some of the same books but also highlighted asexual characters in Guardian of the Dead, Banner of the Damned, and Clariel. In 2018, Bustle pointed to three writers who had books with asexual protagonists: Kathryn Ormsbee (Tash Hearts Tolstoy), Claire Kann (Let's Talk About Love), and Alice Oseman (Radio Silence). Oseman's 2020 novel Loveless specifically deals with the protagonist coming to terms with her asexual and aromantic identity while at university.
Heartstopper is an upcoming LGBT British coming-of-age television series developed for Netflix, based on the webcomic and graphic novel of the same name by Alice Oseman.
